Filtering functions

Source: vignettes/Filtering.Rmd
Filtering.Rmd
library(Rcongas)
library(dplyr)
data('example_object')

print(example_object)
#> x Warning ATAC 0-counts cells. 195 cells have no data in any of 36 segments, top 5 with missing data are:
#> x Cell CACAACAGTGGCATAG-CRC_17 with 2 0-segments (6%)
#> x Cell GAACCGCAGGTTACAA-CRC_17 with 2 0-segments (6%)
#> x Cell GGAACCCGTTGTGACT-CRC_17 with 2 0-segments (6%)
#> x Cell AAACGAATCACGTGTA-CRC_17 with 1 0-segments (3%)
#> x Cell AAACTCGAGTCTGCTA-CRC_17 with 1 0-segments (3%)
#> ── [ (R)CONGAS+ ] Example object for (R)CONGAS+ ────────────────────────────────
#> 
#> ── CNA segments (reference: GRCh38)
#> → Input 36 CNA segments, mean ploidy 3.67.
#> 
#>     |  | | | | |  |  | | | | | | |  |  |   | |    | |  |  
#> 
#>   Ploidy:    0     1     2     3     4     5     *
#> 
#> ── Modalities
#> → RNA: 4548 cells with 16005 mapped genes, 16748279 non-zero values. Likelihood: Gaussian.
#> → ATAC: 4999 cells with 210 mapped peaks, 1040663 non-zero values. Likelihood: Negative Binomial.
#> ! Clusters: not available.
#> [1] 0

Filtering functions

Filtering functions are available for data before it is loaded into the package, or after.

Before loading

Functions that pre-process data before being inputed to the tool work requiring data in a format ready for usage in the tool; the output is the very same tibble with filtered entries (rows).

After loading

Functions that process data that has already being inputed to the tool work and return an object.

Removing outliers from segments

After mapping counts data to segments, a function can be used to determine quantiles of mapped data, and identify outliers in each segment and modality.

An outlier can then be removed or capped to the median cell value. The former option introduced 0-counts in the data, which we suggest to check with the stat function, and possibly remove by using the filter_missing_data function. Removal can be important as an excess of 0-counts cells (missing data) will drive the fit to use 0-mean components.

Outliers are identified by using a quantile range \(q = (q_l, q_r)\) with \(q_r,q_l\in [0,1]\) reporting lower and upper quantiles. The quantiles are computed and applied per segment.

# 1 segment from the object
segment_id = example_object %>% 
  get_input('segmentation') %>% 
  filter(row_number() == 1) %>% 
  pull(segment_id)
  
# Original segment plot
segment_plot = plot_data(example_object, what = 'histogram', segments = segment_id)
#> → Normalising ATAC counts using input normalisation factors.

# Filter with default values, capping
f_example_object = example_object %>% filter_outliers(action = 'cap')
#> 
#> ── RNA quantiles: lower 0.01, upper 0.99.
#> ℹ n = 3312 entries capped at median cell value
#> 
#> ── RNA recomputing normalisation factors.
#> → Gaussia likelihood, normalisation factors are already coherced to 1.
#> 
#> ── ATAC quantiles: lower 0.01, upper 0.99.
#> → Normalising ATAC counts using input normalisation factors.
#> ℹ n = 3598 entries capped at median cell value
#> 
#> ── ATAC recomputing normalisation factors.
#> → Computing library size factors as total counts.
#> → Median digits per factor 4, scaling by 10000.
#>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
#>  0.0535  0.1146  0.1463  0.2060  0.2152 41.1764

# Capped segment plot
segment_plot_2 = plot_data(f_example_object, what = 'histogram', segments = segment_id)
#> → Normalising ATAC counts using input normalisation factors.

# Filter with default values, remove entries
f2_example_object = example_object %>% filter_outliers(action = 'remove')
#> 
#> ── RNA quantiles: lower 0.01, upper 0.99.
#> ℹ n = 3312 entries to remove
#> 
#> # A tibble: 3,312 x 9
#>    segment_id  cell   value modality value_type original_value q_min q_max del  
#>    <chr>       <chr>  <dbl> <chr>    <chr>               <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <lgl>
#>  1 chr1:14326… AACC…  -90.9 RNA      G                   -90.9 -89.1  71.6 TRUE 
#>  2 chr1:14326… AAGA…  115.  RNA      G                   115.  -89.1  71.6 TRUE 
#>  3 chr1:14326… ACAC…   90.2 RNA      G                    90.2 -89.1  71.6 TRUE 
#>  4 chr1:14326… ACCA…  -97.3 RNA      G                   -97.3 -89.1  71.6 TRUE 
#>  5 chr1:14326… ACCC… -101.  RNA      G                  -101.  -89.1  71.6 TRUE 
#>  6 chr1:14326… ACCC… -105.  RNA      G                  -105.  -89.1  71.6 TRUE 
#>  7 chr1:14326… ACGT…  -89.5 RNA      G                   -89.5 -89.1  71.6 TRUE 
#>  8 chr1:14326… ACGT…   82.7 RNA      G                    82.7 -89.1  71.6 TRUE 
#>  9 chr1:14326… ACTA…  115.  RNA      G                   115.  -89.1  71.6 TRUE 
#> 10 chr1:14326… ACTA…   79.8 RNA      G                    79.8 -89.1  71.6 TRUE 
#> # … with 3,302 more rows
#> 
#> ── RNA recomputing normalisation factors.
#> → Gaussia likelihood, normalisation factors are already coherced to 1.
#> 
#> ── ATAC quantiles: lower 0.01, upper 0.99.
#> → Normalising ATAC counts using input normalisation factors.
#> ℹ n = 3598 entries to remove
#> 
#> # A tibble: 3,598 x 9
#>    segment_id   cell     value modality value_type original_value   q_min  q_max
#>    <chr>        <chr>    <dbl> <chr>    <chr>               <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>
#>  1 chr1:143264… AAACT… 0.00407 ATAC     NB                     34 0.00600 0.0226
#>  2 chr1:143264… AAAGA… 0.00419 ATAC     NB                     12 0.00600 0.0226
#>  3 chr1:143264… AACGG… 0.0726  ATAC     NB                    123 0.00600 0.0226
#>  4 chr1:143264… AATAC… 0.0293  ATAC     NB                     53 0.00600 0.0226
#>  5 chr1:143264… AATAC… 0.00560 ATAC     NB                     11 0.00600 0.0226
#>  6 chr1:143264… AATGG… 0.00390 ATAC     NB                     24 0.00600 0.0226
#>  7 chr1:143264… AATGT… 0.0241  ATAC     NB                     56 0.00600 0.0226
#>  8 chr1:143264… ACAAA… 0.0278  ATAC     NB                     98 0.00600 0.0226
#>  9 chr1:143264… ACAGA… 0.00421 ATAC     NB                     45 0.00600 0.0226
#> 10 chr1:143264… ACCAA… 0.00589 ATAC     NB                     12 0.00600 0.0226
#> # … with 3,588 more rows, and 1 more variable: del <lgl>
#> 
#> ── ATAC recomputing normalisation factors.
#> → Computing library size factors as total counts.
#> → Median digits per factor 4, scaling by 10000.
#>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
#>  0.0109  0.1131  0.1447  0.2026  0.2125 41.1764
#> ! With remove this filter will introduce 0-counts for outliers, consider removing them with filter_missing_data.

# Removed segment plot
segment_plot_3 = plot_data(f2_example_object, what = 'histogram', segments = segment_id)
#> → Normalising ATAC counts using input normalisation factors.

# Show the difference
cowplot::plot_grid(
  segment_plot,
  segment_plot_2, # capped
  segment_plot_3, # removed
  nrow = 3,
  ncol = 1
)

If you used The returned object will contain fewer entries; it should be checked for an excess of zeros after filtering. We show an example below

Compare 0-count cells before and after the filter

# RNA 0-counts difference
stat(example_object)$zero_counts_cells_RNA %>% print
#> NULL
stat(f_example_object)$zero_counts_cells_RNA %>% print  # capped
#> NULL
stat(f2_example_object)$zero_counts_cells_RNA %>% print # removed
#> # A tibble: 877 x 4
#>    cell                 n   `%` modality
#>    <chr>            <int> <dbl> <chr>   
#>  1 ACTGTCCAGACCAGAC    33    92 RNA     
#>  2 TGGATCACAATCAGCT    32    89 RNA     
#>  3 GTGGAGATCCACAGGC    31    86 RNA     
#>  4 TACACCCGTACGAAAT    31    86 RNA     
#>  5 TACCTGCCATGGCCCA    31    86 RNA     
#>  6 AGCGATTCAATTTCTC    30    83 RNA     
#>  7 TGCATCCAGCTCGAAG    30    83 RNA     
#>  8 AGTACTGAGGGCCAAT    29    81 RNA     
#>  9 CTGAGGCCAGGTCAGA    29    81 RNA     
#> 10 AGTTCCCCACGGCCAT    28    78 RNA     
#> # … with 867 more rows
# ATAC 0-counts difference
stat(example_object)$zero_counts_cells_ATAC %>% print
#> # A tibble: 195 x 4
#>    cell                        n   `%` modality
#>    <chr>                   <int> <dbl> <chr>   
#>  1 CACAACAGTGGCATAG-CRC_17     2     6 ATAC    
#>  2 GAACCGCAGGTTACAA-CRC_17     2     6 ATAC    
#>  3 GGAACCCGTTGTGACT-CRC_17     2     6 ATAC    
#>  4 AAACGAATCACGTGTA-CRC_17     1     3 ATAC    
#>  5 AAACTCGAGTCTGCTA-CRC_17     1     3 ATAC    
#>  6 AAACTCGCAAGACTTC-CRC_17     1     3 ATAC    
#>  7 AACAAAGCAAGACTAA-CRC_17     1     3 ATAC    
#>  8 AACCAACTCGCTGATA-CRC_17     1     3 ATAC    
#>  9 AACGGGAAGAGCACTG-CRC_17     1     3 ATAC    
#> 10 AACGTACCAGCAACCC-CRC_17     1     3 ATAC    
#> # … with 185 more rows
stat(f_example_object)$zero_counts_cells_ATAC %>% print  # capped
#> # A tibble: 195 x 4
#>    cell                        n   `%` modality
#>    <chr>                   <int> <dbl> <chr>   
#>  1 CACAACAGTGGCATAG-CRC_17     2     6 ATAC    
#>  2 GAACCGCAGGTTACAA-CRC_17     2     6 ATAC    
#>  3 GGAACCCGTTGTGACT-CRC_17     2     6 ATAC    
#>  4 AAACGAATCACGTGTA-CRC_17     1     3 ATAC    
#>  5 AAACTCGAGTCTGCTA-CRC_17     1     3 ATAC    
#>  6 AAACTCGCAAGACTTC-CRC_17     1     3 ATAC    
#>  7 AACAAAGCAAGACTAA-CRC_17     1     3 ATAC    
#>  8 AACCAACTCGCTGATA-CRC_17     1     3 ATAC    
#>  9 AACGGGAAGAGCACTG-CRC_17     1     3 ATAC    
#> 10 AACGTACCAGCAACCC-CRC_17     1     3 ATAC    
#> # … with 185 more rows
stat(f2_example_object)$zero_counts_cells_ATAC %>% print # removed
#> # A tibble: 1,571 x 4
#>    cell                        n   `%` modality
#>    <chr>                   <int> <dbl> <chr>   
#>  1 TATCGAGGTTCTTTCA-CRC_17    29    81 ATAC

#>  9 ACAGGCCCAACTGCGC-CRC_17    22    61 ATAC    
#> 10 CCCACATGTCCCGAGT-CRC_17    22    61 ATAC    
#> # … with 1,561 more rows

The extent of the new 0-counts cells can be summarised printing the filtered object to console.

f_example_object %>% print
#> x Warning ATAC 0-counts cells. 195 cells have no data in any of 36 segments, top 5 with missing data are:
#> x Cell CACAACAGTGGCATAG-CRC_17 with 2 0-segments (6%)
#> x Cell GAACCGCAGGTTACAA-CRC_17 with 2 0-segments (6%)
#> x Cell GGAACCCGTTGTGACT-CRC_17 with 2 0-segments (6%)
#> x Cell AAACGAATCACGTGTA-CRC_17 with 1 0-segments (3%)
#> x Cell AAACTCGAGTCTGCTA-CRC_17 with 1 0-segments (3%)
#> ── [ (R)CONGAS+ ] Example object for (R)CONGAS+; post-map q[0.01, 0.99] cap ────
#> 
#> ── CNA segments (reference: GRCh38)
#> → Input 36 CNA segments, mean ploidy 3.67.
#> 
#>     |  | | | | |  |  | | | | | | |  |  |   | |    | |  |  
#> 
#>   Ploidy:    0     1     2     3     4     5     *
#> 
#> ── Modalities
#> → RNA: 4548 cells with 16005 mapped genes, 16748279 non-zero values. Likelihood: Gaussian.
#> → ATAC: 4999 cells with 210 mapped peaks, 1040663 non-zero values. Likelihood: Negative Binomial.
#> ! Clusters: not available.
#> [1] 0
f2_example_object %>% print
#> x Warning RNA 0-counts cells. 877 cells have no data in any of 36 segments, top 5 with missing data are:
#> x Cell ACTGTCCAGACCAGAC with 33 0-segments (92%)
#> x Cell TGGATCACAATCAGCT with 32 0-segments (89%)

#> x Cell TACCTGCCATGGCCCA with 31 0-segments (86%)

#> x Cell TATCGAGGTTCTTTCA-CRC_17 with 29 0-segments (81%)
#> x Cell TGGAAGGCAGATTTGC-CRC_17 with 29 0-segments (81%)

#> x Cell GATGATCCAGATTTGC-CRC_17 with 28 0-segments (78%)

#> ── Modalities

#> [1] 0

Removing 0-count cells

Some cells can have have 0-counts because they have no events mapping to a certain segment, or because other filtering functions have removed entries, an inflated the number of 0-count cells.

A filter is available to remove cells that have 0-counts in a proportion \(p\in[0,1]\) of

0-count entries will be imputed to have value 0 by the fit algorithm. In case of an excess of 0-counts the model will try to explain 0-values with mixture components peaked at 0, which can make the inference more instable. We suggest therefore to remove such entries with this filtering function.

We make a concrete example working with the f2_example_object object creted by the previous filter. As shown above, after filtering segment’s outliers

# Observe the number of cells
print(f2_example_object)
#> x Warning RNA 0-counts cells. 877 cells have no data in any of 36 segments, top 5 with missing data are:
#> x Cell ACTGTCCAGACCAGAC with 33 0-segments (92%)
#> x Cell TGGATCACAATCAGCT with 32 0-segments (89%)
#> x Cell GTGGAGATCCACAGGC with 31 0-segments (86%)
#> x Cell TACACCCGTACGAAAT with 31 0-segments (86%)
#> x Cell TACCTGCCATGGCCCA with 31 0-segments (86%)
#> x Warning ATAC 0-counts cells. 1571 cells have no data in any of 36 segments, top 5 with missing data are:
#> x Cell TATCGAGGTTCTTTCA-CRC_17 with 29 0-segments (81%)
#> x Cell TGGAAGGCAGATTTGC-CRC_17 with 29 0-segments (81%)
#> x Cell AGATAGATCTCGCGGA-CRC_17 with 28 0-segments (78%)
#> x Cell GATGATCCAGATTTGC-CRC_17 with 28 0-segments (78%)
#> x Cell TTCATTGCAGATTTGC-CRC_17 with 27 0-segments (75%)
#> ── [ (R)CONGAS+ ] Example object for (R)CONGAS+; post-map q[0.01, 0.99] remove ─
#> 
#> ── CNA segments (reference: GRCh38)
#> → Input 36 CNA segments, mean ploidy 3.67.
#> 
#>     |  | | | | |  |  | | | | | | |  |  |   | |    | |  |  
#> 
#>   Ploidy:    0     1     2     3     4     5     *
#> 
#> ── Modalities
#> → RNA: 4548 cells with 16005 mapped genes, 16748279 non-zero values. Likelihood: Gaussian.
#> → ATAC: 4999 cells with 210 mapped peaks, 1040663 non-zero values. Likelihood: Negative Binomial.
#> ! Clusters: not available.
#> [1] 0

# Apply the filter
f2_example_object = f2_example_object %>% filter_missing_data()
#> x Warning RNA 0-counts cells. 877 cells have no data in any of 36 segments, top 5 with missing data are:
#> x Cell ACTGTCCAGACCAGAC with 33 0-segments (92%)
#> x Cell TGGATCACAATCAGCT with 32 0-segments (89%)
#> x Cell GTGGAGATCCACAGGC with 31 0-segments (86%)
#> x Cell TACACCCGTACGAAAT with 31 0-segments (86%)
#> x Cell TACCTGCCATGGCCCA with 31 0-segments (86%)
#> x Warning ATAC 0-counts cells. 1571 cells have no data in any of 36 segments, top 5 with missing data are:
#> x Cell TATCGAGGTTCTTTCA-CRC_17 with 29 0-segments (81%)
#> x Cell TGGAAGGCAGATTTGC-CRC_17 with 29 0-segments (81%)
#> x Cell AGATAGATCTCGCGGA-CRC_17 with 28 0-segments (78%)
#> x Cell GATGATCCAGATTTGC-CRC_17 with 28 0-segments (78%)
#> x Cell TTCATTGCAGATTTGC-CRC_17 with 27 0-segments (75%)
#> 
#> ── RNA modality, proportions cut 0.05
#> → Cells with missing data 877, removing 449
#> 
#> ── ATAC modality, proportions cut 0.05
#> → Cells with missing data 1571, removing 653

# Reduced number of cells
print(f2_example_object)
#> x Warning RNA 0-counts cells. 877 cells have no data in any of 36 segments, top 5 with missing data are:
#> x Cell ACTGTCCAGACCAGAC with 33 0-segments (92%)
#> x Cell TGGATCACAATCAGCT with 32 0-segments (89%)
#> x Cell GTGGAGATCCACAGGC with 31 0-segments (86%)
#> x Cell TACACCCGTACGAAAT with 31 0-segments (86%)
#> x Cell TACCTGCCATGGCCCA with 31 0-segments (86%)
#> x Warning ATAC 0-counts cells. 1571 cells have no data in any of 36 segments, top 5 with missing data are:
#> x Cell TATCGAGGTTCTTTCA-CRC_17 with 29 0-segments (81%)
#> x Cell TGGAAGGCAGATTTGC-CRC_17 with 29 0-segments (81%)
#> x Cell AGATAGATCTCGCGGA-CRC_17 with 28 0-segments (78%)
#> x Cell GATGATCCAGATTTGC-CRC_17 with 28 0-segments (78%)
#> x Cell TTCATTGCAGATTTGC-CRC_17 with 27 0-segments (75%)
#> ── [ (R)CONGAS+ ] Example object for (R)CONGAS+; post-map q[0.01, 0.99] remove ─
#> 
#> ── CNA segments (reference: GRCh38)
#> → Input 36 CNA segments, mean ploidy 3.67.
#> 
#>     |  | | | | |  |  | | | | | | |  |  |   | |    | |  |  
#> 
#>   Ploidy:    0     1     2     3     4     5     *
#> 
#> ── Modalities
#> → RNA: 4548 cells with 16005 mapped genes, 16748279 non-zero values. Likelihood: Gaussian.
#> → ATAC: 4999 cells with 210 mapped peaks, 1040663 non-zero values. Likelihood: Negative Binomial.
#> ! Clusters: not available.
#> [1] 0
